About The Conch Paradox

The Book

The Conch Paradox emerged from the intersection of personal crisis and professional insight. When our family faced a life-threatening medical emergency with our unborn son, the journey from Aruba to Rotterdam became more than a geographic transition—it became a profound exploration of resilience itself.

Preface

This book was born on the Erasmus bridge in Rotterdam. As an economist studying resilience in Small Island Developing States, I’ve spent years analyzing vulnerability indices, economic diversification strategies, and adaptive governance frameworks. My professional work has focused on understanding how island nations like my home of Aruba navigate their unique challenges: geographic isolation, limited resources, exposure to climate risks, and economic dependencies.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description:
This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are:

  1. You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r});
  2. A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc.

There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown. For example, you can write a task list with Blackfriday but not with Pandoc:
